title: SPX Shows Little Weakness, Difficult to Hold All-Time Highs
text: The SPX once again hit new all-time highs this morning as Alex Coffey notes strong technical trends in the index. That said, he argues it's "always difficult to project resistance" at highs.

title: US markets open in green as markets look at Fed meeting, S&P 500, Nasdaq in green
text: US equities opened in green on Tuesday as investors weighed strong corporate earnings from several major firms against weaker results from others, while keeping a close eye on the Federal Reserve's upcoming interest rate decision. The benchmark S&P 500 index was up 0.22% to 6,403.91.

title: The Fed Decides | Live Coverage
text: Bloomberg Television analyzes the latest Fed rate decision with top guests and market reaction and analysis. Our special coverage begins at 1 pm ET on Wednesday followed by the decision at 2 pm.

title: S&P500: Market Holds Steady Today – Earnings Support Sentiment Ahead of Fed Call
text: S&P500 holds steady after record close. Earnings outpace forecasts, but caution prevails ahead of key economic data and Fed decision.

title: "Buckle Up:" BA Earnings, Fed Meeting & Tariff Talks Kick Off Tuesday
text: Headlines are moving at a pace that's "almost too much," says Kevin Hincks. He notes continuing tariff talks with China happening in Sweden catching investor attention, adding that today's FOMC meeting will be under the microscope before tomorrow's interest rate decision.

title: U.S. Seals Trade Deal With EU, And It's Even Bigger Than Japan's
text: President Trump announced a major trade deal with the EU, reducing tariff threats and expanding economic cooperation. The EU committed to buying $750 billion in US LNG and nuclear fuel, plus $600 billion in US investments over three years.

title: A Risk This Market Is Not Accounting For
text: Stocks are rallying on optimism over Trump's EU trade deal, but the details and timeline of promised investments remain unclear. Tariffs, even at a reduced 15%, are a regressive tax that disproportionately hurts lower-income consumers and raises costs for US businesses.

title: The Stock Market Melt-Up Could Peak With The US-EU Trade "Deal"
text: The US-EU trade deal likely marks the top of the recent US stock market melt-up, as the focus shifts from trade deal negotiations to hard economic data. The tariffs are set to significantly increase after August 1st, which is likely to cause stagflation in the US and a global economic slowdown, ultimately a recession.

title: The market is betting on a September rate cut, says Partners Group's Anastasia Amoroso
text: Anastasia Amoroso, Partners Group chief investment strategist for private wealth and retirement, joins 'Squawk Box' to discuss the Fed's inflation fight, what to expect from the central bank this week, state of the economy, rate path outlook, and more.

title: Top 2 Tech And Telecom Stocks That Are Ticking Portfolio Bombs
text: As of July 29, 2025, two stocks in the communication services sector could be flashing a real warning to investors who value momentum as a key criteria in their trading decisions.

title: Trump deciding trade deals by Aug. 1, Commerce Secretary Lutnick says
text: U.S. President Donald Trump will make his trade deal decisions this week even as separate negotiations with China and the European Union continue, U.S. Commerce chief Howard Lutnick said on Tuesday ahead of Trump's self-imposed Aug. 1 deadline.

title: CNBC Fed Survey: Respondents see a three-way tie in race to replace Fed Chair Powell
text: CNBC's Steve Liesman joins 'Squawk Box' to break down the latest results from CNBC Fed Survey.

title: IMF upgrades global growth forecast as Trump tariffs ease, but warns on risks
text: Despite reduced tensions and EU trade deal, US policies are ‘highly uncertain', says Washington-based organisation

title: I.M.F. Raises Global Growth Outlook as U.S. Looks to Avert Trade Wars
text: The International Monetary Fund warned that trade tension continued to be a risk for the global economy.

title: IMF lifts U.S. growth outlook on lower tariffs and upbeat markets
text: While global growth is seen as resilient, the factors holding it up are viewed as temporary.

title: Trade deficit sinks to 22-month low as businesses try to time Trump tariffs. GDP to get boost.
text: The nation's trade deficit in goods sank 11% in June to a 22-month low as U.S. companies grappled with on-again, off-again Trump tariffs, a pattern that's likely to play out at least a few more months.

title: Bessent, Warsh, Hassett are the leading contenders to get Fed chair job, CNBC survey finds
text: The CNBC Fed Survey found the leading contenders to succeed Jerome Powell as Fed Chair are Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh and Kevin Hassett, the National Economic Council director. The probability of a recession in the next year has fallen to 31% from 38% in June and 53% in May after the president announced sharply higher "reciprocal" tariffs.

title: Wall Street's Most Accurate Analysts Weigh In On 3 Consumer Stocks With Over 3% Dividend Yields
text: During times of turbulence and uncertainty in the markets, many investors turn to dividend-yielding stocks. These are often companies that have high free cash flows and reward shareholders with a high dividend payout.

title: Will Powell and the Fed cut rates in response to Trump's pressure?
text: The Federal Reserve holds its latest interest rate meeting this week, with policymakers expecting rates to be left unchanged despite President Donald Trump's calls for interest rate cuts.

title: How America's rising oligarchy and ‘pay-to-play' politics could sink the stock market
text: Today's new “Gilded Age” could get its political and financial comeuppance.
